121.content:
" Go there, and kidnap her. I cannot let her pseudo-pacifism ruin my plans. Am I understood? "

Your head rose to face your master as he spoke in his usual theatrical tone. Dooku stood in front of you, with a harsh smile stamped in his face, looking to your kneeling figure.

" Yes, my master. " you replied in a low voice.

The Sith Lord nodded silently, before retreating to his office. As your master left the room, you stood up once more.
You took a deep breath while slowly advancing towards Dooku's hangar. Several Vulture droids moved through the facility, where dozens of Geonosian fighters lined up immobile. Small groups of B1 droids and natives moved along the ships, carefully examining their state. In the middle of the snubfighters, the Confederate Pride waited. The black colored Z-95 Headhunter stood out from the other starships, being easy to find in the huge maze of Nantex starfighters.

You carefully entered your ship's cockpit, immediately taking off the hangar into the barren lands of the N'ge'u Valley. The burning sun of Geonosis shone strongly against the sky, lighting the desert surface of the planet. The Confederate Pride majestically flew through the skies, quickly leaving the atmosphere. In some minutes, the ship entered in Hyperspace. The stars seemed to elongate in beautiful twirls of lights as the ship traveled to accomplish the mission.
_________________

The deep darkness of the night had fell over the skies of Theed when the Confederate Pride exited Hyperspace with a shining light. The shuttle descended to the surface of the planet, calmly landing over the green grass of the Great Plains. You stepped out of the craft, deeply breathing the fresh air of the Naboo's nights. The grass under your feet was wet from the day's rains and your boots sunk in the mud as you walked hardly towards Theed. After about an hour of walking, Theed's tall skyline appeared as you slowly crossed the hilly landscape.

" It's showtime " you thought, while mentally assembling the last parts of your plan.

123.content:
You were once a Jedi, a very talented one at that. Your skills with the force and the lightsaber were praised by your instructors...that is when they weren't scolding you for being vain and greedy. As you grew older you became more and more irritated with the lifestyle of the Jedi and realized it was impossible for you to follow, so you escaped from the Jedi Order. After that, you came into contact with a Sith Lord who offered to teach you the ways of the Dark Side of the force, you accepted, believing that being a Sith would give you limitless freedom...but again like the Jedi the Sith had a ridiculous lifestyle that you loathed. Things like love, compassion, or mercy were looked down upon by the Sith who opted to instead act like stereotypical card carrying villains. When you were still with the Jedi Order you almost didn't believe how cliche the Sith were and just believed that the Jedi were exaggerating...oh how wrong you were. However, you endured the absurdity of the Sith lifestyle to learn certain skills from your master, who you later killed with a thermal detonator when he slept.

Now you live your life how you want to, with no ancient and absurd doctrine dictating your every move. But now, something may threaten your lifestyle. You have sensed an incredibly powerful Sith in the Galaxy, a man who you discovered was called Darth Tyranus. Normally this wouldn't be a problem, you'd just avoid him but the problem is that Tyranus is the leader of the Confederacy of Independent Systems and may very well change the face of the galaxy. You liked the way things are now, the Republic is corrupt and incompetent which allows you to steal easily, and the Jedi are too full of themselves and foolish to catch you. Tyranus was up to something, and you wanted to put a stop to it.

You learned that apparently Tyranus had ordered the death of some senator from Naboo who was an outspoken critic of the Military Creation Act, you didn't really care much for Republic politics but you did your best to ensure the Senator survived. You discovered a bomb had been placed in a landing pad where the Senator's shuttle would have landed and passed this information on to the authorities who quickly disarmed the bomb and foiled the assassination attempt but you knew this assassin would try again. You grabbed your speeder bike and waited outside the Senator's apartment. Sure enough, a droid went to the Senator's window and deposited what looked like kouhuns inside the Senator's room. You sped towards the Senator to save her but were surprised to see Jedi barging into the room, one of the Jedi killed the bugs while another spoofed the droid and was about to jump to catch it before it went back to its owner. You didn't need Jedi interfering with your plan so you force pushed this meddlesome jedi back into the room and followed the droid alone.

After a few minutes you soon discovered the droid's owner, a female in a purple bodysuit. She quickly spots you and grabs a sniper rifle from her speeder and fires a few shots at you, you easily deflected her blasts and one of them even destroyed her droid. The assassin was clearly panicking now, she put her rifle back into her speeder and drives off. You give chase, you had to know who she was and what she knew. The assassin pulls out her blaster pistol and begins firing at you, you easily deflect her shots and began closing in on her. You could sense her fear growing, but you didn't need the force to know that. Her driving became erratic and she began firing faster and with less accuracy. You realized that if you kept this up she would crash and probably wind up dead, you slowed down a little while deflecting more of her shots. The assassin then dove and turned sharply to the left and out of sight. But you still sensed her and followed her without being seen, you could sense the assassin was calming down, she probably thought she had eluded you. You kept your distance from the assassin's speeder and then saw her land, the assassin stepped out and removed the veil from her face and then entered what looked like a night club. You land your speeder bike close to the club and enter, despite the large crowd you easily sensed your prey and closed in. You saw the assassin at the bar picking up a shot with shaky hands and quickly gulping it.

She then turned around to see you standing right behind her, her eyes widened and her mouth opened as if she were silently screaming. She reached for her blaster but you used the force to take it from her and then flung her across the room, she hit the wall with a loud thud and laid on the floor unconscious. You see the other bar patrons staring at you, you had to think of something quickly. You could claim you're a Jedi, after all these idiots probably couldn't tell the difference between a Sith and a Jedi.

"Don't worry, this is jedi business." You pick up the injured assassin with no trouble from the bar patrons who were either too scared to oppose you or bought your lie. You carry the assassin to a back alley and lay her against a wall, she was still out cold and you took this time to examine her body. You noticed that she was barefoot and only wore toe rings and an anklet on her feet. You examined the jewelry pieces and found symbols on them, symbols you recognized as Mabari symbols. This woman was a Mabari warrior, she may be of some use to you.

You needed to wake her up to interrogate her, you pull out some smelling salts from your bag and put them under her nose. She begins to stir, and her eyes open but she begins groaning in pain.

"Good you're awake. What do they call you?"

She looked at you with fear but she answered your question. "Zam...Zam Wesell..."

"Nice name, now Zam let's get down to business. Do you know who it was you were trying to kill?" You begin the interrogation immediately.

She grunts but begins answer. "It was the senator from Naboo."

"And who hired you?" You wanted to confirm your suspicions.

"It was just a job..." She winced and moaned in pain.

You rolled your eyes, her wounds weren't even that bad. "Here, this will help with the pain." You placed your hand on her chest and used the force to dull the pain in Zam's body and also start to hypnotize her. Zam's breathing became shallower and her eyes became glazed.

"Now, tell me who hired you."

"It...it was a bounty hunt-"

You sensed something. "Hold that thought." You immediately use the force to stop a projectile from hitting Zam's neck. Zam looked in shock and awe, you looked up to see an armored figure staring at you before flying off. You examined the dart but then placed it in your sack for study or later use.

"You were saying?" You looked back at Zam.

"Uh...it was a bounty hunter called Jango Fett that hired me."

"A bounty hunter hired you to kill a senator?" This didn't seem right.

"He sub-contracted me...but I guess the person who really wanted to kill the senator was-"

"Tyranus."

"How did you..."

"Not important, do you know why he wanted the senator dead? She's a critic of the Military Creation Act and I doubt Tyranus wants the Republic to have an army to threaten his Confederacy."

"I don't know...I'm just a bounty hunter, I don't care too much about politics."

You sighed, Zam didn't know much but she may still be useful to you. Now what were you to do now?
123.title: Zam Wesell (Shape-shifting Bounty Hunter chick)...

1351.content:
You had arrived on Coruscant a week ago with your mentor and friend Zam Wesell. The two of you were hunting a smuggler who had arrived on Coruscant to receive a shipment of Death Sticks, the hunt went well and the Galaxy had one less smuggler in it. Still, you wondered why you were still on Coruscant even though you had completed the hunt. You assumed that Zam had other business here but you haven't seen her mention anything of the sort. Still, you didn't complain. The hotel you and Zam were staying in was more comfortable than what you were normally used to, but you feared that such luxury would dull your skills.

You sat at a table as you polished your armor while listening to music, Zam was sitting on the couch playing watching a movie on the holonet, her bare feet propped up on a table. Zam used to wear boots before, but she stopped wearing any kind of footwear after learning a new Mabari fighting style that helped her fight in close quarters and run faster. You didn't complain, in fact, while you'd never admit it, you loved how Zam was now barefoot virtually all the time.

"Kid, you've been polishing your armor for days, keep it up and you and your shiny armor will be an easy target for snipers." Zam had always used the nickname kid for you, even though you had just turned 19 today. She probably used it due to her being much older than you. You've never asked for her age however, you didn't want to piss her off.

"Just trying to keep to my routine." That being said, you put your armor away.

"Your armor is fine, now come sit down with me." Upon hearing this you felt your face grow hot.

You walked over and sat on the couch with her, although you were an arms length from her. Zam snickered and pulled you in closer, "Come on, I don't bite. She said as she put an arm around your shoulders, now you felt like your face was going to melt off. In addition to being older than you, Zam was also taller than you.

"You need to relax kid, being a bounty hunter means you have plenty of free time between contracts. So it's a good idea to spend some of that time relaxing, wouldn't you say?"

"I-It's also imperative that a hunter keeps his skills sharp and his equipment tidy." You tried to keep your cool but Zam was making it hard. You then found yourself staring at Zam's feet, Zam seemed to have found out you were staring at her feet and began wiggling them for you.

"You like what you see kid?" She grinned.

You quickly tore your eyes from the spectacle, as much as you hated yourself for it.

Zam began chuckling. "Relax kid, you can go ahead and play with my feet if you want. It is your birthday after all. Consider this one of my gifts to you." She said as she laid her head back.

You couldn't believe what you were hearing, Zam had given you permission to play with her feet. This was your dream come true.

153.content:
You adjusted your tuxedo one last time before opening the wooden door that stood in front of you. As you did this, intense white light flood the dark corridor behind you, causing to close your eyes for a second and enter into the meeting room. Immediately, you were greeted by the voice of a 40 years old woman.

"Good evening, agent. Nice to see you could assemble together some free time in the middle of your busy agenda." Handler said in a slightly infuriated tone, while looking at the digital clock at her left. It marked twenty-six past eleven. You should have been there at a quarter to eleven.
"Good evening, Handler. Excuse my unpunctuality."
"You are excused. Regardless of your unpunctual behaviour, the Republican Intel System has made the risk to give you a mission of utmost importance and urgency."
"To clean the Headquarters' toilets, ma'am?" you inquired, with a challenging voice. Handler didn't seem impressed, nor particularly offended and promptly answered:
"Although I trust you would do just fine if I gave that assignment, I'm afraid your mission is more serious than some unwashed bathrooms."

Upon having finished talking, she turned her head away from the shiny wooden table next to which she has sit, and pressed one of the small set of buttons underneath her chair's arm. This made the room's strong light go off, and an holoprojector in the middle of the room to project the image of a young, pink-skinned humanoid who you eventually identified as being a Zeltron.

"She is, or rather was, until a few time ago, one of ours. An agent of the RIS. Her name is Waji Endarag, 24 years old, born in Zeltros."
"And?"
"She b-"
"Wait, you said she was one of ours?"
"In fact, she was, agent. However, she recently became rogue on the Republic and has been ever since running away from us with critical intelligence on Coruscant and Kamino's defense systems. Because the Director of the SIS, Separatist Intelligence Service is said to have over two million pairs of eyes and ears peeking around, the Confederacy has found out and is trying to make contact with her."
"I presume you want me to track Waji down and arrest her."
"Rather intuitive, young boy. There are a few problems, though. First, there seems to be an entire Corps of the Armed Wing of the SIS stationed in Dantooine, where Waji is believed to be hiding. Second, several entities around the Galaxy seem to have their eyes on her. The three most important are the Separatists, of course, Zeltros Defense Ministry which would be most interested in having Waji back on their ranks, and the Corporate Sector, who dreams of an alliance with the CIS. By capturing her, they would have an excellent start of relationship with the Confederacy. Third, as you may know from your previous incident in Zeltros, Zeltron female have powerful pheromones that make males of various species, namely the Human race, submissive toward them. But I trust you will handle this three problems."

You blushed intensely upon remembering of your 'incident' with that Zeltron Military Intelligence agent, that had ever since left you slightly attracted to female feet... you put this bad memories aside and answered the middle-aged bat you called "Boss".

"Of course, ma'am."
"Good. All other information is in your Infopad. Good luck, boy."
153.title: A mission of utmost importance

Upon leaving the room, with your cheeks still in an intense shade of red, you headed directly toward the elevators that gave access to the building's lobby and then, to the small spaceport. You entered the elevator but, as its door began to close, you saw a cascade of red hair flying into the small compartment.

"Oh, hi you!" she said with cheerful smile, straightening her disproportionately large t-shirt, that ended well below the waist.

"Una Fer" you thought. A petit lady, part of the Information Procurement Bureau, she was often seen around your department, likely delivering fresh intelligence to our field agents. In spite of her well-taken-care-of feet, which you had had the opportunity to observe during one of the few parties of the RIS in the sandy coast of Naboo, her somewhat strange and childish behaviour prevented you from give her much attention. Also, you had heard some rumours about her dating a Counter-Intelligence's "muffler" ( an agent whose duty was to make sure no leaked information would find its way to the media, sometimes with the use of ad hoc solutions like censuring all information companies until the story died out, or filtrating transmissions at planetary relaying nods ).

While you meditated about this, and Una continued to straighten her clothes and hair, a robotic voice resonated inside the elevator: "39th Floor: Censure & Propaganda". The doors opened a few more employees of the RIS entered in the metallic compartment. This continued on and on until finally the voice said "Ground floor: Entrance; Main lobby; Internal access to the Spaceport". You then exited, and ran toward the hangar, almost bashing a short Twi'lek in the process.

When you at last reached it, you had to stop abruptly to locate your fighter among the sea of V-Wings ( for some reason, the RIS really liked these kind of small, swift fighters ). Eventually, you found the blueish freighter you usually took for undercover missions, running madly to it before jumping in a pointless hurry. You left the on-vessel computer trace an Hyperspace lane to Dantooine and verified that you had all that you needed for the trip. Some 7 minutes later, the freighter rose toward the skies of Coruscant, leaving the RIS's spaceport behind, before entering Hyperspace, with a multicolour vortex forming around the ship's windows as it did so.

Twenty-one hours and two naps later


You woke up suddenly, with your Infopad on your lap and a small line of saliva pending from the corner of your mouth. Handler's "important information" turned out to be a twelve pages detailed report of the events previous to the precise day. As your eyes opened you still remembered some topics such as Waji's presumed whereabouts and routines.

However, you did not have much time to think about that, for an acute beep resonated through the ship, signalling an incoming message. You hurried to answer and...
